DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of different doses of JNJ-27018966 compared with placebo in the treatment of patients with irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea (IBS-d).
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of JNJ-27018966 in the Treatment of Irritable Bowel Syndrome With Diarrhea
DOC.criteria: Key Patient has a diagnosis of IBS by Rome III criteria with a subtype of diarrhea Female patients must be: postmenopausal, defined as amenorrhea for at least 2 years at Prescreening, surgically sterile (have had a hysterectomy or bilateral oophorectomy, tubal ligation, or otherwise be incapable of pregnancy), abstinent, or if sexually active, be practicing an effective method of birth control. Key Patient has a diagnosis of IBS by Rome III criteria with a subtype of constipation, mixed IBS, or unsubtyped IBS Patient has a history of inflammatory or immunemediated gastrointestinal (GI) disorders including inflammatory bowel disease (ie, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) and celiac disease Patient has a history of diverticulitis within 6 months prior to Prescreening Patient has a history of intestinal obstruction, stricture, toxic megacolon, GI perforation, fecal impaction, gastric banding, bariatric surgery, adhesions, ischemic colitis, impaired intestinal circulation (eg, aortoiliac disease), thrombophlebitis of a major vein, or hypercoagulable states. Other protocolspecific eligibility criteria may apply.
